wigzo.android.sdk

Class Wigzo

  • java.lang.Object
    • wigzo.android.sdk.Wigzo

  • public class Wigzo
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the public API for the Wigzo Android SDK. Get more details here.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Wigzo.WigzoMessagingMode
      Enum used in Wigzo.initMessaging() method which controls what kind of app installation it is.

      • sharedInstance

        public static Wigzo sharedInstance()

      • init

        public Wigzo init(android.content.Context context,
         java.lang.String serverURL,
         java.lang.String appKey,
         java.lang.String orgId)
        Initializes the Wigzo SDK. Call from your main Activity's onCreate() method. Must be called before other SDK methods can be used. Device ID is supplied by OpenUDID service if available, otherwise Advertising ID is used. BE CAUTIOUS!!!! If neither OpenUDID, nor Advertising ID is available, Wigzo will ignore this user.
        Parameters:
        context - application context
        serverURL - URL of the Wigzo server to submit data to; use "https://analytics.wigzo.com" for Wigzo Cloud
        appKey - app key for the application being tracked; find in the Wigzo Dashboard under Management > Applications
        orgId - unique Id for organization provided by wigzo to organization
        Returns:
        Wigzo instance for easy method chaining
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if context, serverURL, appKey, or deviceID are invalid
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Wigzo SDK has already been initialized

      • init

        public Wigzo init(android.content.Context context,
         java.lang.String serverURL,
         java.lang.String appKey,
         java.lang.String deviceID,
         java.lang.String orgId)
        Initializes the Wigzo SDK. Call from your main Activity's onCreate() method. Must be called before other SDK methods can be used.
        Parameters:
        context - application context
        serverURL - URL of the Wigzo server to submit data to; use "https://analytics.wigzo.com" for Wigzo Cloud
        appKey - app key for the application being tracked; find in the Wigzo Dashboard under Management > Applications
        deviceID - unique ID for the device the app is running on; note that null in deviceID means that Wigzo will fall back to OpenUDID, then, if it's not available, to Google Advertising ID
        orgId - unique Id for organization provided by wigzo to organization
        Returns:
        Wigzo instance for easy method chaining
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if context, serverURL, appKey, or deviceID are invalid
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if init has previously been called with different values during the same application instance

      • init

        public Wigzo init(android.content.Context context,
         java.lang.String serverURL,
         java.lang.String appKey,
         java.lang.String deviceID,
         DeviceId.Type idMode,
         java.lang.String orgId)
        Initializes the Wigzo SDK. Call from your main Activity's onCreate() method. Must be called before other SDK methods can be used.
        Parameters:
        context - application context
        serverURL - URL of the Wigzo server to submit data to; use "https://analytics.wigzo.com" for Wigzo Cloud
        appKey - app key for the application being tracked; find in the Wigzo Dashboard under Management > Applications
        orgId - unique Id for organization provided by wigzo to organization
        deviceID - unique ID for the device the app is running on; note that null in deviceID means that Wigzo will fall back to OpenUDID, then, if it's not available, to Google Advertising ID
        idMode - enum value specifying which device ID generation strategy Wigzo should use: OpenUDID or Google Advertising ID
        Returns:
        Wigzo instance for easy method chaining
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if context, serverURL, appKey, or deviceID are invalid
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if init has previously been called with different values during the same application instance

      • isInitialized

        public boolean isInitialized()
        Checks whether Wigzo.init has been already called.
        Returns:
        true if Wigzo is ready to use

        public boolean isInitializedMobile()

      • initMessaging

        public Wigzo initMessaging(android.app.Activity activity,
                  java.lang.Class<? extends android.app.Activity> activityClass,
                  java.lang.String projectID,
                  Wigzo.WigzoMessagingMode mode,
                  java.lang.String orgId)
        Initializes the Wigzo MessagingSDK. Call from your main Activity's onCreate() method.
        Parameters:
        activity - application activity which acts as a final destination for notifications
        activityClass - application activity class which acts as a final destination for notifications
        projectID - ProjectID for this app from Google API Console
        mode - whether this app installation is a test release or production
        Returns:
        Wigzo instance for easy method chaining
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no WigzoMessaging class is found (you need to use wigzo-messaging-sdk-android library instead of wigzo-sdk-android)

      • initMessaging

        public Wigzo initMessaging(android.app.Activity activity,
                  java.lang.Class<? extends android.app.Activity> activityClass,
                  java.lang.String projectID,
                  java.lang.String[] buttonNames,
                  Wigzo.WigzoMessagingMode mode,
                  java.lang.String orgId)
        Initializes the Wigzo MessagingSDK. Call from your main Activity's onCreate() method.
        Parameters:
        activity - application activity which acts as a final destination for notifications
        activityClass - application activity class which acts as a final destination for notifications
        projectID - ProjectID for this app from Google API Console
        buttonNames - Strings to use when displaying Dialogs (uses new String[]{"Open", "Review"} by default)
        orgId - unique Id for organization provided by wigzo to organization
        mode - whether this app installation is a test release or production
        Returns:
        Wigzo instance for easy method chaining
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no WigzoMessaging class is found (you need to use wigzo-messaging-sdk-android library instead of wigzo-sdk-android)

      • halt

        public void halt()
        Immediately disables session & event tracking and clears any stored session & event data. This API is useful if your app has a tracking opt-out switch, and you want to immediately disable tracking when a user opts out. The onStart/onStop/recordEvent methods will throw IllegalStateException after calling this until Wigzo is reinitialized by calling init again.

      • onStart

        public void onStart(android.app.Activity activity)
        Tells the Wigzo SDK that an Activity has started. Since Android does not have an easy way to determine when an application instance starts and stops, you must call this method from every one of your Activity's onStart methods for accurate application session tracking.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if Wigzo SDK has not been initialized

      • onStop

        public void onStop()
        Tells the Wigzo SDK that an Activity has stopped. Since Android does not have an easy way to determine when an application instance starts and stops, you must call this method from every one of your Activity's onStop methods for accurate application session tracking.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if Wigzo SDK has not been initialized, or if unbalanced calls to onStart/onStop are detected

      • onRegistrationId

        public void onRegistrationId(java.lang.String registrationId)
        Called when GCM Registration ID is received. Sends a token session event to the server.

      • recordEvent

        public void recordEvent(java.lang.String key)
        Records a custom event with no segmentation values, a count of one and a sum of zero.
        Parameters:
        key - name of the custom event, required, must not be the empty string
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if Wigzo SDK has not been initialized
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if key is null or empty

      • recordEvent

        public void recordEvent(java.lang.String key,
               int count)
        Records a custom event with no segmentation values, the specified count, and a sum of zero.
        Parameters:
        key - name of the custom event, required, must not be the empty string
        count - count to associate with the event, should be more than zero
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if Wigzo SDK has not been initialized
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if key is null or empty

      • recordEvent

        public void recordEvent(java.lang.String key,
               int count,
               double sum)
        Records a custom event with no segmentation values, and the specified count and sum.
        Parameters:
        key - name of the custom event, required, must not be the empty string
        count - count to associate with the event, should be more than zero
        sum - sum to associate with the event
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if Wigzo SDK has not been initialized
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if key is null or empty

      • recordEvent

        public void recordEvent(java.lang.String key,
               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> segmentation,
               int count)
        Records a custom event with the specified segmentation values and count, and a sum of zero.
        Parameters:
        key - name of the custom event, required, must not be the empty string
        segmentation - segmentation dictionary to associate with the event, can be null
        count - count to associate with the event, should be more than zero
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if Wigzo SDK has not been initialized
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if key is null or empty

      • recordEvent

        public void recordEvent(java.lang.String key,
               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> segmentation,
               int count,
               double sum)
        Records a custom event with the specified values.
        Parameters:
        key - name of the custom event, required, must not be the empty string
        segmentation - segmentation dictionary to associate with the event, can be null
        count - count to associate with the event, should be more than zero
        sum - sum to associate with the event
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if Wigzo SDK has not been initialized
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if key is null or empty, count is less than 1, or if segmentation contains null or empty keys or values

        Enable or disable automatic view tracking
        Parameters:
        enable - boolean for the state of automatic view tracking

      • isViewTrackingEnabled

        public boolean isViewTrackingEnabled()
        Check state of automatic view tracking
        Returns:
        boolean - true if enabled, false if disabled

        public Wigzo recordView(java.lang.String viewName)

      • setUserData

        public Wigzo setUserData(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> data)
        Deprecated. use #Wigzo().sharedInstance().userData.setUserData(Map) to set data and #Wigzo().sharedInstance().userData.save() to send it to server.
        Sets information about user. Possible keys are:
        • name - (String) providing user's full name
        • username - (String) providing user's nickname
        • email - (String) providing user's email address
        • organization - (String) providing user's organization's name where user works
        • phone - (String) providing user's phone number
        • picture - (String) providing WWW URL to user's avatar or profile picture
        • picturePath - (String) providing local path to user's avatar or profile picture
        • gender - (String) providing user's gender as M for male and F for female
        • byear - (int) providing user's year of birth as integer
        Parameters:
        data - Map<String, String> with user data

      • setUserData

        public Wigzo setUserData(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> data,
                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> customdata)
        Deprecated. use #Wigzo().sharedInstance().userData.setUserData(Map, Map) to set data and #Wigzo().sharedInstance().userData.save() to send it to server.
        Sets information about user with custom properties. In custom properties you can provide any string key values to be stored with user Possible keys are:
        • name - (String) providing user's full name
        • username - (String) providing user's nickname
        • email - (String) providing user's email address
        • organization - (String) providing user's organization's name where user works
        • phone - (String) providing user's phone number
        • picture - (String) providing WWW URL to user's avatar or profile picture
        • picturePath - (String) providing local path to user's avatar or profile picture
        • gender - (String) providing user's gender as M for male and F for female
        • byear - (int) providing user's year of birth as integer
        Parameters:
        data - Map<String, String> with user data
        customdata - Map<String, String> with custom key values for this user

      • setCustomUserData

        public Wigzo setCustomUserData(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> customdata)
        Deprecated. use #Wigzo().sharedInstance().userData.setCustomUserData(Map) to set data and #Wigzo().sharedInstance().userData.save() to send it to server.
        Sets custom properties. In custom properties you can provide any string key values to be stored with user
        Parameters:
        customdata - Map<String, String> with custom key values for this user

      • setLocation

        public Wigzo setLocation(double lat,
                double lon)
        Set user location. Wigzo detects user location based on IP address. But for geolocation-enabled apps, it's better to supply exact location of user. Allows sending messages to a custom segment of users located in a particular area.
        Parameters:
        lat - Latitude
        lon - Longitude

      • setCustomCrashSegments

        public Wigzo setCustomCrashSegments(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> segments)
        Sets custom segments to be reported with crash reports In custom segments you can provide any string key values to segments crashes by
        Parameters:
        segments - Map<String, String> key segments and their values

      • addCrashLog

        public Wigzo addCrashLog(java.lang.String record)
        Add crash breadcrumb like log record to the log that will be send together with crash report
        Parameters:
        record - String a bread crumb for the crash report

      • logException

        public Wigzo logException(java.lang.Exception exception)
        Log handled exception to report it to server as non fatal crash
        Parameters:
        exception - Exception to log

      • enableCrashReporting

        public Wigzo enableCrashReporting()
        Enable crash reporting to send unhandled crash reports to server

      • setDisableUpdateSessionRequests

        public Wigzo setDisableUpdateSessionRequests(boolean disable)
        Disable periodic session time updates. By default, Wigzo will send a request to the server each 30 seconds with a small update containing session duration time. This method allows you to disable such behavior. Note that event updates will still be sent every 10 events or 30 seconds after event recording.
        Parameters:
        disable - whether or not to disable session time updates
        Returns:
        Wigzo instance for easy method chaining

      • setLoggingEnabled

        public Wigzo setLoggingEnabled(boolean enableLogging)
        Sets whether debug logging is turned on or off. Logging is disabled by default.
        Parameters:
        enableLogging - true to enable logging, false to disable logging
        Returns:
        Wigzo instance for easy method chaining

      • isLoggingEnabled

        public boolean isLoggingEnabled()

      • currentTimestamp

        public static int currentTimestamp()
        Utility method to return a current timestamp that can be used in the wigzo API.

      • enablePublicKeyPinning

        public static Wigzo enablePublicKeyPinning(java.util.List<java.lang.String> certificates)
        Allows public key pinning. Supply list of SSL certificates (base64-encoded strings between "-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----" and "-----END CERTIFICATE-----" without end-of-line) along with server URL starting with "https://". Wigzo will only accept connections to the server if public key of SSL certificate provided by the server matches one provided to this method.
        Parameters:
        certificates - List of SSL certificates
        Returns:
        Wigzo instance
